title: Grade 1
subject: Essential Elements for English Language Arts (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards Essential Elements for English Languange Arts

6E525AEDBA8E4E7E9CF391132EAB359B.description:
With guidance and support, demonstrate
understanding of words by identifying real-life
connections between words and their use.

C75313FFFC8247FB9B5327FBCF6D132A.description:
With guidance and support, identify attributes of
familiar words.

A7A2CD88BA1942CB8A1CBB99A930AD25.description:
With guidance and support, sort common objects
into familiar categories.

C0615D00A7224CA4B885A91645FEB3F0.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of word
relationships.

8E8D6B1AF03143BDA3DC6F8928FF42CC.description:
Demonstrate understanding of words used in every
day routines.

64AA83D04F344519852E3614206DB2A0.description:
Demonstrate emerging knowledge of word
meanings.

23C886D6877A490C841D5564CA006363.description:
With guidance and support during shared writing,
identify the letters that represent sounds needed to
spell words.

D1E9E3B8A510496F9A2F47589CAF479C.description:
With guidance and support, use letters to create
words.

B0D6EF16DB7D4434B31E95CE5B09F680.description:
With guidance and support during shared writing,
put a period at the end of a sentence.

75FB6D4CDC51407A8C2E00A73DD01134.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of
conventions of standard English.

EFCBB256ED564D1DBFB93FE4CE3AA8DD.description:
With guidance and support, use simple question
words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what).

11511A04F683401E91F67A44293B1D39.description:
With guidance and support, use common
prepositions (e.g., on, off, in, out).

53005F6E06EB465AB5216B4411DB240D.description:
With guidance and support, use familiar frequently
occurring adjectives (e.g., big, hot).

D3F173FE5F654983A40AB11DA2D9828B.description:
With guidance and support, use familiar personal
pronouns (e.g., I, me, and you).

6F56B358E30949DE8B04700F7B9956AD.description:
Use frequently occurring plural nouns in
communication.

DC0C58505A794E3EA3F2A658FB872E26.description: Use frequently occurring nouns in communication.

C64BC30CC7254A88B8454B388DD4BD18.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of letter
and word use.

E50FC68F4FB14C1D84578DD0238981BD.description:
With guidance and support, provide more
information to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

B87853250CF8467DA4EB0B1700E183EA.description:
Add or select drawings or other visual or tactual
displays that relate to familiar people, places, things, and
events.

70C60DFCDA1C43BCB8CAAF8146F4D162.description:
Identify familiar people, places, things, and
events.

99731DC72AE7494DB1A932B1B382F611.description:
Communicate confusion or lack of
understanding ("I don't know.").

16459DA04943424E9BA61433BD0FB4B9.description:
During shared reading activities, answer
questions about details presented orally or through other
media.

D17B0F345E874A57BE5788CB2EF77B8B.description:
Uses one or two words to ask questions related to
personally relevant topics.

B9C4D6C280BE43A18B9653CAF812790D.description: Build on comments or topics initiated by an adult.

97FC58FC697D485494DC7E3BDE3DABDD.description:
Engage in multiple-turn exchanges with supportive
adults.

728DA917CF0744B7BC8103F879BA4EDA.description:
With guidance and support from adults, identify
information related to personal experiences and answer
simple questions about those experiences.

909562575E004210957AF1AD92D01733.description:
With guidance and support, participate in shared
research and writing projects.

8897439E2FF24D2AB823526442C057BC.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

7F10BD52F7424D2D9A49676B48816A56.description:
With guidance and support from adults, explore a
variety of digital tools to produce individual or group writing.

022AE1FA75784DA1A638193CFFBED90F.description:
With guidance and support from adults, add
more information to own drawing, dictation, or writing to
strengthen it.

9841A2E313984A7A96BDF85BFA4CA76A.description:
Select an event and use drawing, dictating, or
writing to share information about it.

2C3D022FAF974FA48C9138091CFA811F.description:
Select a familiar topic and use drawing, dictating,
or writing to share information about it.

B79D21E295FA41F7BB023BF16275BBD8.description:
Select a familiar book and use drawing, dictating,
or writing to state an opinion about it.

E2EEA65C93F84D5885F1D97485625E8C.description:
Participate in shared reading of a variety of reading
materials reflecting a variety of text genre.

DD80CCA6F3F342298BAF6B0085D54C28.description: Engage in sustained, independent study of books.

B716D7ACF5AF4BF99BB6D30F55477E20.description: Begin to attend to words in print.

9D1DB59BB068459F8D73D83DA7302557.description:
With guidance and support, recognize familiar
words that are used in every day routines.

52BD70D3056244AF8FA35598DDF21203.description: Identify upper case letters of the alphabet.

9DD8EF8D599B43E0863786CD2F93F367.description:
Demonstrate emerging letter and word
identification skills.

7565A50365A741E39C03398E0B65E540.description:
With guidance and support, substitute individual
sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words
to make new words.

0D84FF1A823045AAA82A8A467C3074BF.description:
Identify a single syllable spoken word with the
same onset (beginning sound) as a familiar word.

8C0759A2D02343F2BF50AB45FB0819E3.description:
With guidance and support, match orally presented
segmented phonemes (e.g., C-A-T) to pictures or
words illustrating the corresponding word.

1C40503EE44347D2A712F3B6CE218E09.description:
Demonstrate understanding of spoken words,
syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

AD4A08EA172F45B785BA6CA0F745C6E6.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the organization
and basic features of print (e.g., left-to-right, top-tobottom orientation of print, one-to-one
correspondence between written and spoken
word).

1E825CFAC33F485A8CF07CD9509F8B1B.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of the
organization of print.

88B6A059C77A4F1FB0A024CE10FF40DB.description: Reading and Writing Standards: Foundational Skills

91E72F011B4546FEB5ACC9EBC76DF4EF.description:
Actively engage in shared reading of
informational text.

AA8166E999ED47698BE89170690C9397.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

ECBFAFF0C7154B738057928DA9AEC852.description:
With guidance and support, match similar parts
of two texts on the same topic.

A84DB947E3E542FFA59F8D49D74D941C.description:
Identify points the author makes in a familiar
informational text.

5DC30430405642D8A2E4E073FE682F67.description:
Identify illustrations or objects/tactual information
that go with a familiar text.

D8039120E3EE43B79A6705F922CC2185.description:
Distinguish between words and illustrations in a
text.

619B37B5DDCB41708B74D4D0263800CC.description:
Locate the front cover, back cover, and title page
of a book.

6C8630080D4B4F77998B11B605B5C820.description:
With guidance and support, ask a reader to
clarify the meaning of a word in a text.

069FCF0974804921A4F767A9CABBA564.description:
Identify individuals, events, or details in a familiar
informational text.

D0440EAD9D4E4095807E06DFF7326CF3.description:
With guidance and support, identify details
related to the topic of a text.

D69B4DA306EF4C44941714A7138D7D97.description:
With guidance and support, actively engage in
shared reading for a clearly stated purpose.

B8365F78BA6144DABF406C0553A06ECF.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

A3C66A38169B400F8079BFDCCF9661DE.description:
With guidance and support identify adventures
or experiences of characters in a story as same or different.

115E912C9CCF4029AAB9B05D8D2A49E8.description:
Identify illustrations or objects/tactual
information that go with a familiar story.

0471AECD53D5470F8AFC544E995C617E.description:
With guidance and support, identify a speaker
within a familiar story.

BA7B791DD3A64EB4AF1AD525C7BC0C1D.description:
With guidance and support, identify a text as
telling a story.

B11EAB3DE7424BC19D4BBA92E6D4A981.description:
With guidance and support, identify sensory or
feeling words in a familiar story.

CDF6A3DD9834452CB1A2A8FC8637B50E.description:
Identify characters and settings in a familiar
story.

F71E368DC63341079A5C541D8FF73357.description:
With guidance and support, recount major
events in familiar stories.
